intro: Centropogon oblongus, commonly known as the narrowleaf piper, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits. Centropogon oblongus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
